question: Guess the next number in the series: 21, 26, 34, 45, __?

Two cars begin 450 miles apart and begin driving directly toward each other. One car proceeds at a rate of 60 miles per hour, while the other proceeds at a rate of 45 miles per hour. Rounding down, many minutes will it take for the two drivers to be 150 miles apart?

A lady decided to treat her neighbours in the manner that she gives one-third of his total stock of candies and one extra to the first neighbour, and then the one-third of the remaining stock along with one extra to the second and continues giving away in this fashion. Her total stock exhausted after she gave away to 7 neighbours. How many candies were there in her stock initially?
Guess the number (in place of ?) in the series: 2, 12, 43, 235, ? , 6702.

Asgard city is 13 Km. towards the East of Vormir city. A bus starts from Vormir travels 8 Km. towards West and takes a right turn. After taking the right turn, it travels 4.5 Km. and reaches Titan city. From Titan the bus takes a right turn again, travels 21 Km. and stops. How far and towards which direction must the travel to reach Asgard?
The number of solutions (a, b, c) to the equation a - b - c = 37, where a, b, and c are positive integers such that a≤35, b≤17, and c≤17 is?
Stevan is twice as old as David. He will be twice as old as Martin in 10 years. If Martin is 2 years old, how old is David?

John sold a pair of toys (Doraemon and Superman) at 25% profit. The profit obtained from Doraemon was 20%. If he reduced the both cost price of the Doraemon and selling price of the Doraemon by $200, his profit on the pair would have risen to 30%. Earlier cost price of the Superman was $80 less than half of the selling price of the Doraemon. What price should he mark on a pair of Doraemon and Superman to earn a profit of 50%?
